comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Oglesby Young was an Oregon railroad attorney.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Josephus Daniels was Secretary of the Navy during both of Woodrow Wilson's administrations (1913-1921). (Franklin D. Roosevelt was Assistant Navy Secretary then.) Wikipedia entry on Josephus Daniels: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Josephus_Daniels Although Daniels opposed the 1914 U. S. Naval Occupation of Vera Cruz, Mexico, he followed President Woodrow Wilson's orders and supervised the occupation. This photo may be connected with the Vera Cruz incident. Perhaps an inspection tour for bigwigs?

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Clarence L Reames was a US District Attorney in Portland Oregon. See books.google.com/books?id=YryZAAAAIAAJ&pg=PA123&l... So maybe this is either in Oregon or a delegation from Oregon.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: I wonder if it might be a committee that has come to inspect the U. S. Navy facilities at Galveston, Texas -- point of embarkation for the U. S. invasion of the Mexican port of Vera Cruz.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A Robert Aubrey Miller was also from Oregon: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_A._Miller_(Oregon_politician)

comment.author: 25564641@N08
comment._content: I think this photo was taken during WWI as Reames career rose during the war.
